member.name: T:ClearScada.Client.AccessControlEntry
member.summary: Specifies a set of security permissions for a particular user.
member.remarks: An AccessControlEntry specifies a set of permissions for a particular user that control what data and operations that user has access to. An AccessControlEntry can apply to either a single user, a user group, or the special users Everyone, Guest or Web.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.AccessControlEntry.Everyone
member.summary: The to use to indicate the AccessControlEntry applies to all users.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.AccessControlEntry.Guest
member.summary: The to use to indicate the AccessControlEntry applies to the Guest user for non-web clients.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.AccessControlEntry.Web
member.summary: The to use to indicate the AccessControlEntry applies to the Guest user for web clients.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AccessControlEntry class with the specified user and permissions.

The set of permissions granted to the user by the AccessControlEntry.

member.summary: Gets the name of the user the applies to.
member.value: A containing the name of the user the AccessControlEntry applies to.

member.name: P:ClearScada.Client.AccessControlEntry.Permissions
member.summary: Gets the permissions specified by the .

member.name: T:ClearScada.Client.AccessControlList
member.summary: Represents the security of a database object.
member.remarks: The AccessControlList class is a collection of objects that represent the security of a particular database object. An AccessControlEntry specifies a set of permissions for a particular user that control what data and operations that user has access to. An AccessControlEntry can apply to either a single user, a user group, or the special users Everyone, Guest or Web.

member.name: M:ClearScada.Client.AccessControlList.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AccessControlList class that is empty.

member.name: M:ClearScada.Client.AccessControlList.#ctor(ClearScada.Client.AccessControlList)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AccessControlList class that contains entries copied from the specified AccessControlList.
member.param: The AccessControlList whose entries are copied to the new AccessControlList.
member.exception: is .

member.name: P:ClearScada.Client.AccessControlList.InheritedFromParent
member.summary: Gets and sets a value indicating whether this AccessControlList is inherited.
member.value: if the AccessControlList is inherited; otherwise, .

remarks.para: When an AccessControlList is returned from a call to GetSecurity, InheritedFromParent will be if the ACL was inherited from the object's parent, or if the ACL belongs to object itself.

When an AccessControlList is passed to a call to SetSecurity, set InheritedFromParent to to remove the ACL from the object and cause it to inherit from its parent, or to replace the object's ACL. If InheritedFromParent is then the contents of the AccessControlList will be ignored.

member.value: An containing the number of entries in the AccessControlList.

member.value: An ICollection<> containing the users in the AccessControlList.

member.name: P:ClearScada.Client.AccessControlList.Values
member.summary: Gets a collection containing the entries in the AccessControlList.
member.value: An ICollection<> containing the entries in the AccessControlList.

member.name: M:ClearScada.Client.AccessControlList.TryGetValue(System.String,ClearScada.Client.AccessControlEntry@)
member.summary: Gets the for the specified user.
member.param: The name of the aggregate to get.
When this method returns, contains the AccessControlEntry for the specified user, if found; otherwise, . This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: if the AccessControlList contains an entry for the specified user; otherwise, .
member.remarks: This method combines the functionality of the ContainsKey method and the Item property. Use the TryGetValue method if your code frequently attempts to access entries that are not in the AccessControlList. Using this method is more efficient than catching the thrown by the Item property.

member.name: M:ClearScada.Client.Advanced.ScxComLinkServer.LogOnProvisionalUser(System.String,System.Security.SecureString)
member.summary: Attempts to Provisonal Logon the system's logged on user to this node/server. An attempt can only fail if the server is not ready and requires this client to retry the attempt. A Failed or successful attempt does not imply anything about the logon credentials.
member.param: The username of the system logged on user which needs to be provisional logged on to this node server. An empty string implies a logoff.
The password of the system logged on user; or blank to logoff the provisional logon.
member.returns: false indicates a failed attempt due to server unavailability. All other attempts succeed (though may not create a functioning provisional logon).

member.name: P:ClearScada.Client.Advanced.ScxComLink.ConnectionUseable
member.summary: ConnectionUseable indicates whether a request can be sent. A connection can become unuseable when an outstanding response exists on the connection but the application did not receive a timely response. Essentially, if there is a response outstanding for a stream the link should not be used again and needs to be closed. (If a message-based transport is being used, this might not invalidate the use of the link.)

member.name: T:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions
member.summary: Specifies flags that control access to the data and operations of a database object.
member.remarks: Some permissions are only relevant for certain types of object e.g. Override is only relevant for points.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.None
member.summary: Specifies no access.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.Browse
member.summary: Controls whether an object is listed when enumerating the children of its parent.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.Configure
member.summary: Controls whether an object can be configured, e.g. modifying configuration properties, renaming an object, creating new objects in a group.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.Security
member.summary: Controls whether an object's security can be modified, and whether users and user groups and be configured.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.SystemAdmin
member.summary: Controls whether system administration operations can be performed, e.g. mounting a historic archive, modifiying system configuration, shutting down server. Most system administration operations require SystemAdmin permission on the database's root group

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.Control
member.summary: Controls whether the object can be controlled, e.g. modifying most data properties, controlling a point, generating a report.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.AcceptAlarms
member.summary: Controls whether the object's alarms can be accepted.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.DisableAlarms
member.summary: Controls whether the object's alarms can be disabled.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.Override
member.summary: Controls whether the object's value can be overriden.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.Notes
member.summary: Controls whether the object's notes can be set.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.RetrieveData
member.summary: Controls whether data retrieval can be initiated for the object e.g. one shot an outstation.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.DisableControl
member.summary: Controls whether controls can be be disabled for the object.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.Promote
member.summary: Controls whether the object can be promoted.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.SwitchLine
member.summary: Controls whether the object can switch communications channels.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.Tune
member.summary: Controls whether the object's alarm limits can be tuned.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.Diagnostics
member.summary: Controls whether the object diagnostic and monitoring facilities can be accessed.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.ModifyHistoric
member.summary: Controls whether the object's historic data can modified.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.AnnotateHistoric
member.summary: Controls whether the object's historic data can be annotated.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.ValidateHistoric
member.summary: Controls whether the object's historic data can be validated.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.ViewAlarms
member.summary: Controls whether the object's alarms can be read.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.Read
member.summary: Controls whether the object can be read.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.ExclusiveControl
member.summary: Controls whether the object can be taken under exclusive control.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.ManageExclusiveControl
member.summary: Controls whether exclusive control of the object can be taken away from another user.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.RemoveAlarms
member.summary: Controls whether the object's alarms can be removed.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.EnableDisable
member.summary: Controls whether the object can be enabled or disabled.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.ManualRedirect
member.summary: Controls whether the object's alarms can be manually redirected.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.UnacceptAlarms
member.summary: Controls whether the object's alarms can be unaccepted.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.AssignAlarms
member.summary: Controls whether the object's alarms responsibility can be modified.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.OnOffScan
member.summary: Controls whether the object can be set on or off scan.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.CancelRequest
member.summary: Controls whether the object's requests can be canceled.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.Operator
member.summary: A set of permissions typically used for Operator users.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.Advanced
member.summary: A set of permissions typically used for Advanced users.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.Engineer
member.summary: A set of permissions typically used for Engineer users.

member.name: F:ClearScada.Client.ObjectPermissions.Full
member.summary: All available permissions.

member.name: P:ClearScada.Client.ServerSystemMonitor.PreferredNode
member.summary: Gets the current preferred ServerNode to connect to.
member.value: The current preferred to connect to; or, a if there are no available ServerNodes, or Start has not been called.
member.remarks: A node is available if the ClearSCADA database server is running on it, and is in the SynchronizingHistoric Main or Standby state. If multiple nodes are available, then the one with the lowest Cost is preferred. If available multiple nodes have the same cost, then if one is Main it is preferred, otherwise the choice is arbitrary.

member.remarks:
The value of a property can be one of following types:
The value can also be a single-dimensioned of any of the above types.
To determine the type of a property, use the DataType property of the corresponding . Setting the value of a property to an instance of a different supported type will attempt to convert the value. Setting the value of a property to an instance of an unsupported type will throw an .
To set the value of a property of one of the object's aggregates or alarm conditions, prefix the name of the property with the name of the aggregate or alarm condition, concatenated with a period e.g. obj.SetValue( "Historic.Compress", true );. Alternatively, acccess the aggregates and alarm conditions directly using the and properties.

member.summary: Sets the values of multiple configuration properties of the object in a single transaction.
member.param: The names of the properties to set. Each element of propertyNames corresponds to the element of values with the same index.
The values of the properties. Each element of values corresponds to the element of propertyNames with the same index.
member.remarks: When setting large numbers of properties, using SetProperties is more efficient than using SetProperty to set each property individually. member.name: M:ClearScada.Client.Simple.DBObject.RegisterForPropertyUpdates(System.String[])
member.summary: Causes events to be raised when the one of the specified properties of the object changes value.
member.param: The property names for which to raise update events.

remarks.para: This method causes the event to be raised whenever the one of the properties specified by changes value. If the method is called again with a different set of properties, the two sets will be merged. To stop events being raised, call UnregisterPropertyUpdates.

To raise events when a property of one of the object's aggregates or alarm conditions changes value, prefix the name of the property with the name of the aggregate or alarm condition, concatenated with a period e.g. obj.RegisterForPropertyUpdates( "Historic.LastUpdateTime" );.

member.exception: The DBObject's is not connected to a server.

is .
-or-
An element of is .
is empty.
The object has been deleted from the database.
One of the elements of does not specify the name of a property of the object.
The caller does not have the necessary permissions.
An error occurred communicating with the server.

member.name: M:ClearScada.Client.Simple.DBObject.UnregisterPropertyUpdates
member.summary: Stops events being raised when properties of the object change value.
member.remarks: It is safe to call this method without having called RegisterForPropertyUpdates.
member.exception: The DBObject's is not connected to a server.
An error occurred communicating with the server.

member.name: P:ClearScada.Client.Simple.PropertyDefinition.Length
member.summary: Gets the length of a property.
member.value: An containing the maximum number of characters that can be stored in this property, if the property is a property; otherwise, 1.

member.name: P:ClearScada.Client.Simple.PropertyDefinition.IsReadable
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the value of the property can be read.
member.value: if the value of the property can be read; otherwise, .
member.remarks: This property indicates whether a property is fundamentally readable. It does not check if the caller has the necessary permissions to read the property.

member.name: P:ClearScada.Client.Simple.PropertyDefinition.IsWritable
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the value of the property can be written.
member.value: if the value of the property can be written; otherwise, .
member.remarks: This property indicates whether a property is fundamentally writable. It does not check if the caller has the necessary permissions to write to the property, or if the property is controlled by a template. To check if a property is writable for a particular object, use IsPropertyWritable. To get the permissions needed to write to this property, use .

member.name: P:ClearScada.Client.Simple.PropertyDefinition.WritePermissions
member.summary: Gets the permissions needed to write to this property.
member.value: An containing the permissions needed to write to this property.
member.remarks: For configuration properties, this will always be Configure. For most data properties, this will be Control, however some data properties may need a different set of permissions.
